docs.snippet: Another social media giant is tinkering with what users see, although probably not for weeks. And be careful about asking for notifications.

headline.print_headline: Instagram Feed Is Changing, but Not Yet
headline.main: Instagram Is Changing Its Feed, but (Calm Down) Not Yet

docs.abstract: Instagram says planned changes to its feed are weeks or months away for most users, despite pop-up messages that seemed to indicate change was imminent.

docs.snippet: Each year the Facebook chief executive announces a self-improvement project. And now a number of “brogrammers” follow his lead.

headline.print_headline: They Want to Be Like Mark
headline.main: For Some Men, Mark Zuckerberg Is a Lifestyle Guru

docs.abstract: Facebook chief executive Mark Zuckerberg's self-improvement project, in which he takes on new personal challenge each year, has inspired many millennials in tech industry to make self-improvement goals of their own.

docs.snippet: Google’s Home device puts it in the race to become the go-to company for A.I. — along with several rivals.

headline.main: Silicon Valley’s Artificial Intelligence Marathon Is On

docs.snippet: Crickhowell, population 2,063, has become famous for being one of Britain’s last holdouts against the encroachment of big retail chains.

headline.print_headline: Corporate Tax Avoidance Stirs a Revolt in Wales
headline.main: Welsh Town Leads a British Revolt Against the Tax System and Corporations

docs.snippet: With the help of Periscope, a live video streaming app, and Facebook Live, the cable network that covers Congress got its story.

headline.print_headline: Cameras Off, but Channel Delivers on Sit-In
headline.main: C-Span Delivers on Sit-In, Even With Cameras Off

docs.abstract: C-Span's decision to broadcast impromptu Democratic sit-in over gun control legislation will likely be boost for Periscope, Twitter's new live-streaming app.

docs.snippet: We will now get to see which new ways of doing things actually work and which don’t.

headline.print_headline: A Bright Side to the Financial Stumbles of Digital Media
headline.main: A Bright Side to the Financial Stumbles of Digital Media

docs.snippet: As part of efforts to create a digital single market for online services, the region wants to create rules that would affect companies like Netflix and Facebook.

headline.main: Europe Seeks Greater Control Over Digital Services

docs.abstract: European regulators outline new rules that could compel Netflix and other video streaming services to carry minimum amount of local content in separate countries, and also to assist in paying for implementation; regulators hope to eventually create single digital market in Europe.

docs.snippet: As more tech firms employ their own editing staffs, they are being viewed as something less than news organizations, but more than simple reflections of their growing audiences.

headline.print_headline: Social Media Takes On New Role as News and Entertainment Curator
headline.main: Social Media Finds New Role as News and Entertainment Curator

docs.abstract: Facebook, Twitter and other social media companies are increasing their roles as news and entertainment curators, filling in gaps left by conventional news organizations and hiring editorial specialists to determine platform content; widening influence leads to questions regarding how content is chosen, with some speculating that companies could face new level of scrutiny.

docs.snippet: To protest police violence, an artist resurrected an old N.A.A.C.P. flag about lynching. I wondered if provocative art could help a divided nation confront its past and present.

headline.print_headline: Does This Flag Make You Flinch?
headline.main: Does This Flag Make You Flinch?

docs.abstract: News Analysis; flag created by artist known as Dread Scott, displaying phrase 'A Man Was Lynched by Police Yesterday' hangs outside Jack Shainman Gallery in New York City; art work, linking police shootings of black men to historical lynching of black people in South, is one of growing number of visual art installations capturing terror many in black community feel in time of shootings by, and of, police.

docs.snippet: First-quarter results are expected to be in for Facebook, Amazon, Apple and Twitter, as well as for some of Europe’s largest banks.

headline.print_headline: Tech and Banking Sectors to Give Earnings Reports
headline.main: Technology and Banking Sectors Brace for Earnings Reports
